alert.note: Alert for Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 17 at 4:33PM CST until November 18 at 9:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...LAKE-EFFECT SNOW SHOWERS WILL RESULT IN HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS IN THE SNOWBELT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... .Heavy lake-effect snow showers will impact the western and northern parts of Vilas County tonight, then diminish Friday morning. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Periods of snow showers, heavy at times. A total snow accumulation ranging from 4 to 10 inches in the northwest part of Vilas County, to a couple inches in the Eagle River area. * WHERE...Vilas County. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...An intense snow band with snowfall rates of over one inch per hour is likely to be embedded within the larger area of lake-effect snow showers. This heavier band is expected to impact western Vilas County. A minor shift in the snow band could greatly affect the forecast, so anyone with travel plans tonight or Friday morning should closely monitor the latest forecasts for updates.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
